intro: Evolvulus rosmarinifolius, commonly known as wild lavender or blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Bindweed family (Convolvulaceae) and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant has alternate, narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Evolvulus rosmarinifolius is often found in dry, disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
